alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Phillips; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 9:26PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Jewell, Smith, Phillips, Franklin, southwestern Webster, Furnas and Harlan Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 926 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Cowles to near Harlan County Dam to Hendley. Movement was south at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Phillipsburg, Smith Center, Alma, Cambridge, Arapahoe, Red Cloud, Franklin, Oxford, Beaver City, Logan, Kensington, Orleans, Agra, Lebanon, Holbrook, Stamford, Kirwin, Republican City, Prairie View and Long Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Nebraska. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for north central Kansas.
